entities.name: Enveloped virion
entities.description: A complete virus particle with a lipid envelope. This is a starter entity.

entities.name: Unenveloped virion
entities.description: A naked virus particle without an envelope. This is a starter entity.

entities.name: Positive-sense RNA
entities.description: Positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome. Can be directly translated into proteins.

entities.name: Negative-sense RNA
entities.description: Negative-sense single-stranded RNA genome. Must be transcribed before translation.

entities.name: Polyprotein
entities.description: A large precursor protein that is cleaved into functional viral proteins.

entities.name: RNA-dep. RNA-Polymerase
entities.description: Enzyme that synthesizes RNA from an RNA template

entities.name: Capsid Protein
entities.description: Protein that forms the viral capsid

entities.name: Surface Glycoprotein
entities.description: Protein on the viral surface for cell entry

entities.name: Integrase
entities.description: Can integrate viral DNA into the host chromosome.

entities.name: Replication Co-factor
entities.description: Protein interacting with viral replication. e.g. VPg

effects.name: Translation of viral proteins
effects.description: Spontaneous translation of viral positive sense RNA. Should be modified or complemented with other mechanisms. Can use any ORF.

effects.name: Direct genome release by pore threading
effects.description: Enterovirus-like threading of genome through a pore

effects.name: RdRp activity (picorna-like) - positive-strand
effects.description: RdRp activity

effects.name: RdRp activity (picorna-like) - negative-strand
effects.description: RdRp activity

effects.name: VP mediated assembly of new virions
effects.description: VP packageing

effects.name: Protease activity
effects.description: Self-cleavage of polyprotein

effects.name: Enhanced picorna-like RdRp function
effects.description: Protein primer facilitating RdRp function of picornaviruses

effects.name: IRES mediated protein synthesis
effects.description: IRES based gene expression. Only uses ORF-1

effects.name: Repression of host signaling
effects.description: Shut down of host protein synthesis. Reduces the impact of antiviral response.

effects.name: Shutoff of host protein translation
effects.description: eIF4 based ribosome function is disrupted by viral proteases.

effects.name: Capsid mediated receptor binding
effects.description: Capsid acts as a receptor ligand for binding to the plasma membrane.

effects.name: Endocytosis of bound virions
effects.description: Bound virion is endocytosed.

effects.name: VP1 mediated transport to ER
effects.description: VP1 mediates transport to the ER.

effects.name: Release into cytoplasm from ER
effects.description: Genome complex is released into the cytoplasm

effects.name: Trafficing and release into nucleus
effects.description: Transport to nucleus and genome release

effects.name: Transcription of dsDNA
effects.description: Production of mRNA by host transcription machinery

effects.name: Transport of mRNA to cytoplasm
effects.description: mRNA transport to the cytosol

effects.name: Translation of mRNA
effects.description: Translation of mRNAs produced in the nucleus

effects.name: Import of co-factor into nucleus
effects.description: Replication co-factor is transported to the nucleus

effects.name: Co-factor dependent replication of episomal DNA
effects.description: Master replication protein allows host DNA synthesis machinery to copy episomal dsDNA and pushes cell into S-phase

effects.name: Import of capsid proteins into nucleus
Assembly of new virions in nucleus
effects.description: Assembly of new virions in the nucleus

effects.name: Lytic release of virions from nucleus
Translation of subgenomic RNA
effects.description: Translation of sub-genomic RNA. Targets ORFs from ORF-2 onwards.

effects.name: RdRp production of subgenomic RNA (picorna-like)
effects.description: Production of subgenomic RNA

effects.name: Release of genome complex into cytoplasm
CP mediated assembly of new virions
Transport of surface glycoproteins to ER
effects.description: Surface proteins are translated directly into the ER. Abstracted by moving them after production.

effects.name: Transport of surface proteins to membrane
effects.description: Surface proteins are transported to the membrane.

effects.name: Budding of new virions
effects.description: Virion precursors are budding off from the plasma membrane, taking surface protein with them.

effects.name: Membrane fusion
effects.description: Direct fusion at plasma membrane

effects.name: Uncoating of mononegavirales
effects.description: Unpacks negative sense genome, RdRp and P protein

effects.name: Packing of mononegavirales genome complex
effects.description: Packing of negative sense genome, RdRp and co-factor for new virions

effects.name: H and F mediated budding of virions
Enhanced mononegavirales RdRp through P protein

genes.name: VP1-3
genes.description: Enterovirus capsid proteins.

genes.name: 2Apro Protease
genes.description: Enterovirus 2A Protease. Also responsible for shutting of cap dependent translation.

genes.name: IRES containing UTR
genes.description: Enterovirus UTR

genes.name: 3C Protease
genes.description: Main Enterovirus Protease

genes.name: 3B VPg
genes.description: VPg for Translation

genes.name: 3D Polymerase
genes.description: Enterovirus RdRp

genes.name: BKPyVgp4 VP1
genes.description: BKV VP1 mediates entry through endosome to ER and ultimately release into cytoplasm

genes.name: BKPyVgp2-3 VP2-3
genes.description: BKV VP2 and VP3 mediate transport of viral genome complex into the nucleus.

genes.name: Large T antigen
genes.description: BKV master replication protein. Origin binding and helicase function. DNA synthesis produces very small amounts of Interferon signaling through DNA leakage.

genes.name: Small T antigen
genes.description: Modulates host factors to favor replication

genes.name: Agnoprotein
genes.description: Non-structural late protein

genes.name: nsp1 alpha-type capping
genes.description: Alphavirus 5-prime capping enzyme. Makes cap-0.

genes.name: nsp2 protease
genes.description: Alphavirus protease

genes.name: nsp3 ADP-ribosyl-hydrolase
genes.description: Alphavirus ADP-riposyl-hydrolase. Removes ADP-ribosyl residues and acts as a scaffold for replication

genes.name: nsp3 hypervariable domain
genes.description: HVD of Alphavirus nsp3. Interacts with a lot of host factors. Reduces replication related interferon response.

genes.name: nsp4 RdRp
genes.description: Alphavirus RdRp. Can make sub-genomic RNA. Works better with a co-factor.

genes.name: Capsid protein CP
genes.description: Alphavirus Capsid. A single protein builds the icosahedral shape. Has protease activity

genes.name: Envelope E1-2
genes.description: Alphavirus surface proteins. Mediates attachment and entry.

genes.name: Envelope E3
genes.description: Assists folding and trafficing of Envelope proteins

genes.name: 6k protein
genes.description: Helps envelope protein trafficing

genes.name: Downstream hairpin loop region
genes.description: Allows translation despite host response. Ingame: greatly increases translation of subgenomic RNA

genes.name: Nucleocapsid (N)
genes.description: Helical nucleocapsid

genes.name: Phosphoprotein (P)
genes.description: Essential for Function of Paramyxo L-type RdRps

genes.name: Matrix (M)
genes.description: Required for efficient budding, interacts with F and H proteins

genes.name: Fusion (F)
genes.description: Mediates Fusion at the plasma membrane

genes.name: Hemagglutinin (H)
genes.description: Mediates binding to plasma membrane

genes.name: Large protein (L)
genes.description: L protein, measles variant of the mononegavirales RdRp. Can not work without co-factor.

milestones.name: First Contact
milestones.description: Successfully bind to the cell membrane

milestones.name: Infiltrator
milestones.description: Enter the cytosol for the first time
